description.zh-cn: 韩国首任总统、大韩民国临时政府首任总统。
description.en: The first president of South Korea and the first president of the Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea.

en: President of the Republic of Korea

description.zh-cn: 大韩民国的国家元首。
description.en: The head of state of the Republic of Korea.

en: Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea

description.zh-cn: 日治朝鲜时期在中国成立的朝鲜半岛流亡政府。
description.en: A Korean government-in-exile established in Shanghai, China, during the Japanese colonial rule.

en: Speaker of the National Assembly of South Korea

description.zh-cn: 韩国国会的领导职务。
description.en: The presiding officer of the National Assembly of South Korea.

description.zh-cn: 大韩民国的最高立法机关。
description.en: The supreme legislative body of the Republic of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚的第一任妻子。
description.en: Syngman Rhee's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚的第二任妻子，奥地利人。
description.en: Syngman Rhee's second wife, an Austrian.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚与朴承善的儿子，早夭。
description.en: The son of Syngman Rhee and Park Seung-seon, died young.

description.zh-cn: 导致李承晚下台的学生运动。
description.en: A student uprising that led to the resignation of Syngman Rhee.

description.zh-cn: 韩国独立运动家，大韩民国临时政府领袖。
description.en: Korean independence activist and a leader of the Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 韩国政治家，于1947年被暗杀。
description.en: A Korean politician who was assassinated in 1947.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚政府时期的国防部长官。
description.en: Minister of National Defense during the Syngman Rhee administration.

description.zh-cn: 美国第28任总统，曾任普林斯顿大学校长。
description.en: The 28th U.S. President and former President of Princeton University.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜日治时期的一次大规模朝鲜独立运动。
description.en: One of the earliest public displays of Korean resistance during the rule of Korea by Japan.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜战争期间，韩国政府对共产主义同情者及政治异见者的大规模屠杀。
description.en: A massacre of suspected communists and sympathizers that was carried out by the South Korean government during the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚的亲信，曾任韩国国会议长。
description.en: A close associate of Syngman Rhee, former Speaker of the National Assembly of South Korea.

description.zh-cn: 指1954年韩国自由党为让李承晚能够再次连任总统而强行通过的宪法修正案。
description.en: Refers to the constitutional amendment forced through by the Liberal Party in 1954 to allow Syngman Rhee to run for president again.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader.

en: Government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜民主主义人民共和国的创建者和首任最高领导人。
description.en: The founder and first supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 韩国政治家，曾任国务总理和副总统。
description.en: South Korean statesman, who served as Prime Minister and Vice President.

description.zh-cn: 大韩民国第5至9任总统。
description.en: The 5th to 9th President of South Korea.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜战争期间由美国领导的多国部队。
description.en: The multinational military force led by the United States during the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 第1-3任大韩民国总统。
description.en: 1st-3rd President of the Republic of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 包办婚姻，后离婚。
description.en: Arranged marriage, later divorced.

description.zh-cn: 该学生运动导致李承晚于1960年4月26日辞去总统职务。
description.en: This student movement led to Syngman Rhee's resignation from the presidency on April 26, 1960.

description.zh-cn: 在韩国独立运动初期，两人因思想相同而结为好友。
description.en: In the early days of the Korean independence movement, the two became good friends due to their similar ideologies.

description.zh-cn: 在张德洙被暗杀后，两人关系决裂。金九于1949年被暗杀，外界指李承晚是幕后黑手。
description.en: After the assassination of Chang Tŏk-su, their relationship broke down. Kim Koo was assassinated in 1949, and Syngman Rhee was alleged to be behind it.

description.zh-cn: 1947年张德洙被暗杀，李承晚被指与此事件有关。
description.en: Chang Tŏk-su was assassinated in 1947, and Syngman Rhee was implicated in the event.

description.zh-cn: 评论指称是李承晚派人暗杀金九，刺客安斗熙是受时任李承晚政府国防部长官申性模的指示。
description.en: It is alleged that Syngman Rhee sent people to assassinate Kim Koo, with the assassin Ahn Doo-hee acting under the orders of Shin Sung-mo, the Minister of National Defense in Rhee's government.

description.zh-cn: 时任美国总统威尔逊阻止李承晚参加巴黎和会，使其无法获得出境护照。
description.en: Then-U.S. President Wilson prevented Syngman Rhee from attending the Paris Peace Conference, making him unable to obtain an exit passport.

description.zh-cn: 在三一运动的鼓舞下，流亡海外的韩国独立运动志士成立了临时政府。
description.en: Inspired by the March 1st Movement, exiled Korean independence activists established the Provisional Government.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚当选总统后，为打压韩民党而未提名其党首为国务总理。
description.en: After being elected president, Syngman Rhee suppressed the Korea Democratic Party by not nominating its leader for Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚政府对济州岛的抗议民众进行血腥镇压。
description.en: The Syngman Rhee government brutally suppressed protesters on Jeju Island.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚下令逮捕并处决由共产主义同情者及政治异见者组成的保导联盟之成员。
description.en: Syngman Rhee ordered the arrest and execution of members of the Bodo League, which consisted of communist sympathizers and political dissidents.

description.zh-cn: 李起鹏是李承晚的亲信。
description.en: Lee Ki-poong was a close confidant of Syngman Rhee.

description.zh-cn: 为能使李承晚继续担任下一届总统，自由党提交了取消总统任期限制的修宪法案并强行通过。
description.en: To enable Syngman Rhee to continue serving as president, the Liberal Party submitted and forced through a constitutional amendment to remove presidential term limits.

description.zh-cn: 两人同为反共阵营领袖，倡议建立亚洲“反共联合战线”。
description.en: Both were leaders of the anti-communist bloc and advocated for the establishment of an Asian "anti-communist united front."

description.zh-cn: 韩国在建国后不久便与中华民国政府建立外交关系。
description.en: South Korea established diplomatic relations with the government of the Republic of China shortly after its founding.

description.zh-cn: 执政时期，韩国和中华人民共和国处在互不承认的敌对状态，并在朝鲜战争中直接对抗。
description.en: During his rule, South Korea and the People's Republic of China were in a state of mutual non-recognition and hostility, directly confronting each other in the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚政府与金日成政权互不承认，最终爆发朝鲜战争。
description.en: The Syngman Rhee government and the Kim Il-sung regime did not recognize each other, which ultimately led to the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚政府划定“李承晚线”，在独岛等问题上与日本关系紧张，直至其下台也未能建交。
description.en: The Syngman Rhee government established the "Syngman Rhee Line," leading to tense relations with Japan over issues like the Liancourt Rocks (Dokdo/Takeshima), and diplomatic relations were not established before he was overthrown.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚流亡后，张勉政府拒绝他回国。
description.en: After Syngman Rhee went into exile, the Chang Myon government refused to allow him to return to the country.

description.zh-cn: 李承晚流亡后，朴正熙军政府拒绝他回国。
description.en: After Syngman Rhee went into exile, the Park Chung-hee military government refused to allow him to return to the country.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜战争爆发后，李承晚将军队作战指挥权交给以美国为首的联合国军总司令。
description.en: After the Korean War broke out, Syngman Rhee handed over the operational command of his army to the commander of the UN forces, which were led by the United States.

description.zh-cn: 二战结束后，李承晚乘坐美国专机返回韩国，并在美国支持下建立政府。
description.en: After World War II, Syngman Rhee returned to Korea on a US plane and established his government with American support.
